properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 8 at 8:04PM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by wind gusts of 20 to 30
MPH, which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a
mile.

LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 800 PM EST, a narrow band of locally
heavy snow extended across Clearfield county, mainly just south of
Clearfield and the I-80 corridor, then into western and southern
portions of Centre county, just west and south of State College.

LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...
DuBois, Clearfield, Sandy, Philipsburg, Curwensville, Stormstown,
Hyde, Osceola Mills, Rockton, Chester Hill, North Philipsburg, Port
Matilda, South Philipsburg, Sandy Ridge, Jeffries, Falls Creek, West
Decatur, Wallaceton, Treasure Lake and Penn State Dubois.

For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the
Dubois and Penfield exits, specifically from mile markers 97 to 104.

This includes Interstate 99 from mile markers 58 to 65.

SAFETY INFO...
Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of
heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads
are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this
band of heavy snow passes your location.

Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be
prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra
time to reach your destination.

NWSheadline: A BAND OF LOCALLY HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN CENTRE... CLEARFIELD...AND SOUTHERN CENTRE COUNTIES
